title: Bug 38131ajc needs -d option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage
OB:
After compiling the Test class using the ajc command, the compiled Test.class file is put in the subpackage\subpackage directory.

This means that running the java command results in the following exception:
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: subpackage/Test

Running either of the following commands fixes the problem:
ajc -d . subpackage\Test.java
EB:
The compiled Test.class file should be placed directly in the subpackage directory, not the subpackage\subpackage directory.

Running the java command should not result in any exceptions.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Create a class in a subpackage.
2. Compile the class using the command 'ajc -d . subpackage\Test.java'.
3. Execute the java command to verify that no exceptions are thrown.
